title: Bertus van der Merwe
text:
Albertus Johannes van der Merwe (14 July 1929 – 23 November 1971) was a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Playing career.
Van der Merwe was born in <a href="Rawsonville">Rawsonville</a> and received his schooling at <a href="Worcester%20Gymnasium">Worcester Gymnasium</a>. He studied at the <a href="University%20of%20Cape%20Town">University of Cape Town</a> and played provincial rugby for .
Van der Merwe made his <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20union%29">test match</a> debut for the <a href="Springboks">Springboks</a> against the British Lions in 1955. He then toured with the <a href="Springboks">Springboks</a> to <a href="1956%20South%20Africa%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">Australia and New Zealand in 1956</a> and played in all six test matches during the tour. He also played in tests against in 1958, in 1960 and his last test was against the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a> in 1960. Van der Merwe also played in fourteen tour matches and scored one try.
